display.label: Stripe
display.description: Manage objects connected to your Stripe platform

connections.label: Stripe Connection
connections.comments: Authenticate requests to Stripe using an API Key

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for the API Key.
inputs.label: API Key

documentation.description: The **Stripe** component uses API keys to authenticate requests. You can view and manage your API keys in the Stripe Dashboard. For information on obtaining an API key from Stripe, refer to the [docs](https://stripe.com/docs/api/authentication)

display.label: List Accounts
display.description: Returns a list of accounts connected to your platform

inputs.comments: The maximum time a client will await a response.
inputs.label: Timeout

inputs.comments: Provide an integer value for the maximum amount of results that will be returned.
inputs.label: Limit

inputs.comments: A cursor for use in pagination. starting_after is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include starting_after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.
inputs.label: Starting After

display.label: Raw Request
display.description: Send Raw Request to Stripe

inputs.comments: This is the URL to call.
inputs.label: URL

inputs.comments: The HTTP method to use.
inputs.label: Method

inputs.comments: The HTTP body payload to send to the URL.
inputs.label: Data

inputs.comments: The Form Data to be sent as a multipart form upload.
inputs.label: Form Data

inputs.comments: File Data to be sent as a multipart form upload.
inputs.label: File Data

inputs.placeholder: The file name to apply to a file
inputs.comments: File names to apply to the file data inputs. Keys must match the file data keys above.
inputs.label: File Data File Names

inputs.comments: A list of query parameters to send with the request. This is the portion at the end of the URL similar to ?key1=value1&key2=value2.
inputs.label: Query Parameter

inputs.comments: A list of headers to send with the request.
inputs.label: Header

inputs.comments: The type of data you expect in the response. You can request json, text, or binary data.
inputs.label: Response Type

inputs.comments: The maximum time that a client will await a response to its request
inputs.label: Timeout

inputs.comments: Enabling this flag will log out the current request.
inputs.label: Debug Request

inputs.comments: The delay in milliseconds between retries.
inputs.label: Retry Delay (ms)

inputs.comments: If true, retries on all erroneous responses regardless of type.
inputs.label: Retry On All Errors

inputs.comments: The maximum number of retries to attempt.
inputs.label: Max Retry Count

inputs.comments: Specifies whether to use a pre-defined exponential backoff strategy for retries.
inputs.label: Use Exponential Backoff

inputs.comments: A filter on the list based on the object created field.
inputs.label: Created

inputs.comments: Only return transactions in a certain currency. Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.
inputs.label: Currency

inputs.comments: A cursor for use in pagination. ending_before is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, starting with obj_bar, your subsequent call can include ending_before=obj_bar in order to fetch the previous page of the list.
inputs.label: Ending Before

inputs.comments: Only returns the original transaction.

inputs.comments: An arbitrary string which you can attach to a charge object. It is displayed when in the web interface alongside the charge
inputs.label: Description

inputs.comments: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them.
inputs.label: Metadata

inputs.comments: This is the email address that the receipt for this charge will be sent to. If this field is updated, then a new email receipt will be sent to the updated address.
inputs.label: Receipt Email

inputs.comments: Shipping information for the charge. Helps prevent fraud on charges for physical goods.
inputs.label: Shipping

inputs.comments: A set of key-value pairs you can attach to a charge giving information about its riskiness.
inputs.label: Fraud Details

inputs.comments: A string that identifies this transaction as part of a group.
inputs.label: Transfer Group

display.label: Search Charges
display.description: Search for charges you've previously created using Stripe's Search Query Language.

inputs.comments: The maximum time a client will await a response.
inputs.label: Timeout

inputs.comments: The search query string.
inputs.label: Query

inputs.comments: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 10.
inputs.label: Limit

inputs.comments: A cursor for pagination across multiple pages of results. Dont include this parameter on the first call. Use the next_page value returned in a previous response to request subsequent results.
inputs.label: Page

display.label: Get Charge
display.description: Retrieves the details of a charge that has previously been created.

inputs.comments: The maximum time a client will await a response.
inputs.label: Timeout

display.label: List Payment Intents
display.description: Returns a list of PaymentIntents.

inputs.comments: The maximum time a client will await a response.
inputs.label: Timeout

inputs.comments: Only return PaymentIntents for the customer specified by this customer ID.
inputs.label: Customer

inputs.comments: A filter on the list based on the object created field.
inputs.label: Created

inputs.comments: A cursor for use in pagination. ending_before is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, starting with obj_bar, your subsequent call can include ending_before=obj_bar in order to fetch the previous page of the list.
inputs.label: Ending Before

inputs.comments: Provide an integer value for the maximum amount of results that will be returned.
inputs.label: Limit

inputs.comments: A cursor for use in pagination. starting_after is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include starting_after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.

display.label: Get Payment Intent
display.description: Retrieves the details of a PaymentIntent that has previously been created.

inputs.comments: The maximum time a client will await a response.
inputs.label: Timeout

inputs.comments: The ID of the PaymentIntent to retrieve.
inputs.label: Payment ID

inputs.comments: The client secret of the PaymentIntent. Required if a publishable key is used to retrieve the source.
inputs.label: Client Secret

display.label: Create Payment Intent
display.description: Creates a PaymentIntent object.

inputs.comments: The maximum time a client will await a response.
inputs.label: Timeout

inputs.comments: Amount intended to be collected by this PaymentIntent.
inputs.label: Amount

inputs.comments: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.
inputs.label: Currency

inputs.comments: When enabled, this PaymentIntent will accept payment methods that you have enabled in the Dashboard and are compatible with this PaymentIntents other parameters.
inputs.label: Automatic Payment Methods

inputs.comments: Set to true to attempt to confirm this PaymentIntent immediately.
inputs.label: Confirm

inputs.comments: ID of the Customer this PaymentIntent belongs to, if one exists.
inputs.label: Customer

inputs.comments: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.
inputs.label: Description

inputs.comments: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them.
inputs.label: Metadata

inputs.comments: Set to true to indicate that the customer is not in your checkout flow during this payment attempt, and therefore is unable to authenticate.
inputs.label: Off Session

inputs.comments: ID of the payment method (a PaymentMethod, Card, or compatible Source object) to attach to this PaymentIntent.
inputs.label: Payment Method

inputs.comments: Email address that the receipt for the resulting payment will be sent to.
inputs.label: Receipt Email

inputs.comments: Indicates that you intend to make future payments with this PaymentIntents payment method.
inputs.label: Setup Future Usage

inputs.comments: Shipping information for this PaymentIntent.
inputs.label: Shipping

inputs.comments: For non-card charges, you can use this value as the complete description that appears on your customers statements.
inputs.label: Statement Descriptor

inputs.comments: Provides information about a card payment that customers see on their statements.
inputs.label: Statement Descriptor Suffix

inputs.comments: The amount of the application fee (if any) that will be requested to be applied to the payment and transferred to the application owners Stripe account.
inputs.label: Application Fee Amount

inputs.comments: Controls when the funds will be captured from the customers account.
inputs.label: Capture Method

inputs.comments: Set to true to fail the payment attempt if the PaymentIntent transitions into requires_action.
inputs.label: Error On Requires Action

inputs.comments: ID of the mandate to be used for this payment.
inputs.label: Mandate

inputs.comments: This hash contains details about the Mandate to create.
inputs.label: Mandate Data

inputs.comments: The Stripe account ID for which these funds are intended
inputs.label: On Behalf Of

inputs.comments: If provided, this hash will be used to create a PaymentMethod.
inputs.label: Payment Method Data

inputs.comments: Payment-method-specific configuration for this PaymentIntent.
inputs.label: Payment Method Options

inputs.comments: The list of payment method types that this PaymentIntent is allowed to use.
inputs.label: Payment Method Types

inputs.comments: Options to configure Radar.
inputs.label: Radar Options

inputs.comments: The URL to redirect your customer back to after they authenticate or cancel their payment on the payment methods app or site.
inputs.label: Return Url

inputs.comments: The parameters used to automatically create a Transfer when the payment succeeds
inputs.label: Transfer Data

inputs.comments: A string that identifies the resulting payment as part of a group.
inputs.label: Transfer Group

inputs.comments: Set to true when confirming server-side and using Stripe.js, iOS, or Android client-side SDKs to handle the next actions.
inputs.label: Use Stripe SDK

display.label: Cancel Payment Intent
display.description: A PaymentIntent object can be canceled when it is in one of these statuses: requires_payment_method, requires_capture, requires_confirmation, requires_action or, in rare cases, processing.

inputs.label: Timeout

inputs.comments: The ID of the Payment Intent.
inputs.label: Payment Intent ID

inputs.comments: The reason for cancelling the Payment Intent.
inputs.label: Cancellation Reason

display.label: Update Dispute
display.description: When you get a dispute, contacting your customer is always the best first step. If that doesn't work, you can submit evidence to help us resolve the dispute in your favor.

inputs.label: Timeout

display.label: Close Dispute
display.description: Closing the dispute for a charge indicates that you do not have any evidence to submit and are essentially dismissing the dispute, acknowledging it as lost.

inputs.comments: The maximum time a client will await a response.
inputs.label: Timeout

inputs.comments: The ID of the dispute.
inputs.label: Dispute ID

display.label: Webhook
display.description: Trigger for handling webhooks from Stripe

data.description: Ths is an example Product Description.
data.name: Example Product Name

documentation.description:
You can configure a Stripe [event notification webhook](https://stripe.com/docs/webhooks) to send information to a Prismatic webhook URL under certain conditions (a "Product" is created, a "Order" is updated, etc.).

Additionally, you can reference a trigger's results.webhookUrls to create a webhook in a deploy-triggered flow. That'll configure webhooks to point to an instance when that instance is deployed to a customer.
The **Stripe** component provides functionality for interacting with the Stripe API .
